comment._content: LOC -- you have misspelled "Chihuahua" in your photo title.

comment._content: Thanks Wystan.  I notice that the tagger got the spelling correct.  We'll make the change next time we update the record.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
The ethnic group in Chihuahua State are Tarahumaras, not Aztecs.
Dr. Jesús Roberto Duarte Moreno
Plastic Reconstructive Surgeon
Calle Juan E. García 316, sur
Torreón 2700, Coahuila, México.
Tel. part (871) 721 1598
Tel. cel (871) 788 2348

comment.author: 21371960@N03
comment._content: Actually the correct ethnic name is Rarámuris, as they call themselves. Tarahumaras is the way spaniards called them when tried to conquer this people.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: This picture is also found in Wheelan collection and in  Corbis where it has printed copy right by Mutual Film Co. and dated apparently 1910 or 1916 (?).

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Tarahumaras [Rarámuris] are standing on west side of Plaza de Armas.  Hotel Palacio was located on south-west corner of Libertad Street and Independencia Avenue in Chihuahua City.  The building appreciated behind Tarahumaras [Rarámuris] is  the west wing of  former Municipal Palace where currently is located the Banco Nacional de México (north-east corner).
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Greetings from Torreón, Coahuila, México
Plastic Reconstructive Surgeon

comment.author: 76133074@N04
comment._content: They are not aztecs but raramuris from Chihuahua State.

comment.author: 76133074@N04
comment._content: Opps, I just notice you were told before, sorry!

comment.author: 23275607@N03
comment._content: Hi actually they are the native Indians from that mountainous region. They are Tarahumara.
